fields.description:
After registering an image using euca-register with _-n_ option (name option)  - which is required by AWS, euca-describe-images doesn't display image with name (which breaks AWS compatibility).

*Eucalyptus*

{code}
# euca-register -n precise-kernel precise-06182013-kernel/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-virtual.manifest.xml
IMAGE	eki-7E8E35CD
# euca-describe-images eki-94C4374E
IMAGE	eki-94C4374E	precise-06182013-kernel/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-vmlinuz-virtual.manifest.xml	185153644748	available	private	x86_64	kernel				instance-store
{code}

*AWS*

{code}
# ec2-register -n precise-test precise-test-bucket/image.manifest.xml -K /tmp/cert/pk-WGRQ57KVHUFLNODZW53HEQJZWFLWDKQC.pem -C /tmp/cert/cert-WGRQ57KVHUFLNODZW53HEQJZWFLWDKQC.pem
IMAGE	ami-4353222a
# ec2-describe-images ami-4353222a
IMAGE	ami-4353222a	986451091583/precise-test	986451091583	available	private		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			instance-store	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EPHEMERAL	sda2	ephemeral0
{code}

Per AWS behavior, [DescribeImages|http://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/APIReference/ApiReference-query-DescribeImages.html] returns a table that contains the following rows of information for each image. Each field is separated by a comma. Some of these values may be empty.

* The image information
** The IMAGE identifier
** The ID of the image
** The source of the image
** The ID of the image owner
** The status of the image
** The visibility of the image (public or private)
** The product codes, if any, that are attached to the instance
** The architecture of the image (i386 or x86_64)
** The image type (machine, kernel, or ramdisk)
** The ID of the kernel associated with the image (machine images only)
** The ID of the RAM disk associated with the image (machine images only)
** The platform of the image
** The type of root device (ebs or instance-store)
** The virtualization type (paravirtual or hvm)
** The Hypervisor type (xen or ovm)

* Any Amazon EBS volumes associated with the instance. There will be one of the following for each volume
** The BLOCKDEVICE identifier
** The device name
** The snapshot ID
** The volume size
** Whether or not the volume will be deleted on termination (true or false)
** The volume type
** The maximum IOPS of the volume (I don't think this applies for Eucalyptus)

* Any tags associated with the instance. There will be one of the following for each tag
** The TAG identifier
** The resource type identifier
** The resource ID
** The tag key
** The tag value
fields.summary: euca-describe-images doesn't show "name" passed by euca-register

comments.body:
Start testing with the following version of Eucalyptus:

{code}
[root@g-08-03 ~]# rpm -qa | grep euca
euca2ools-release-3.0-1.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-gl-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-cc-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-release-3.3-1.el6.noarch
python-eucadmin-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-common-java-libs-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-common-java-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
euca2ools-3.0.0-0.20.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-load-balancer-image-1.0.0-0.92.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-sc-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-admin-tools-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.noarch
eucalyptus-cloud-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
eucalyptus-walrus-3.3.0-0.1055.el6.x86_64
{code}

Confirmed behavior.  Attached sosreport with Eucalyptus logging set to EXTREME.  Executed the DescribeImages API call on both platforms with extra debugging information provided.

*Eucalyptus*

{code}
[root@g-08-03 ~]# euca-describe-images eki-94C4374E --debug

{code}

*AWS*

{code}

<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
  <soap:Body>
    <DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2012-12-01/">
      <requestId>605b7f9e-50c3-48f4-94ab-ab99e28ada6c</requestId>
      <imagesSet>
        <item>
          <imageId>ami-4353222a</imageId>
          <imageLocation>precise-test-bucket/image.manifest.xml</imageLocation>
          <imageState>available</imageState>
          <imageOwnerId>986451091583</imageOwnerId>
          <isPublic>false</isPublic>
          <architecture>x86_64</architecture>
          <imageType>machine</imageType>
          <kernelId>aki-88aa75e1</kernelId>
          <name>precise-test</name>
          <rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType>
          <rootDeviceName>/dev/sda1</rootDeviceName>
          <blockDeviceMapping>
            <item>
              <deviceName>sda2</deviceName>
              <virtualName>ephemeral0</virtualName>
            </item>
          </blockDeviceMapping>
          <virtualizationType>paravirtual</virtualizationType>
          <hypervisor>xen</hypervisor>
        </item>
      </imagesSet>
    </DescribeImagesResponse>
  </soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

------------------------------------------------------------------------
IMAGE	ami-4353222a	986451091583/precise-test	986451091583	available	private		x86_64	machine	aki-88aa75e1			instance-store	paravirtual	xen
BLOCKDEVICEMAPPING	EPHEMERAL	sda2	ephemeral0
{code}
slated for the next engineering bug scrub.

This is a tools issue as you can see below the "name" is actually being returned from the CLC but it is not being output form euca2ools
[g-08-08:~]euca-register tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml -n TESTNAME
IMAGE	emi-99FC3C18
[g-08-08:~]euca-describe-images emi-99FC3C18 --debug
{code}
2013-10-04 14:49:51,020 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- response content --
<DescribeImagesResponse xmlns="http://ec2.amazonaws.com/doc/2013-02-01/"><imagesSet><item><imageId>emi-99FC3C18</imageId><imageLocation>tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml</imageLocation><imageState>available</imageState><imageOwnerId>096197277238</imageOwnerId><isPublic>false</isPublic><productCodes/><architecture>x86_64</architecture><imageType>machine</imageType><kernelId>eki-B02C3954</kernelId><ramdiskId>eri-F96C3F88</ramdiskId><platform/><name>TESTNAME</name><rootDeviceType>instance-store</rootDeviceType><rootDeviceName>/dev/sda1</rootDeviceName><blockDeviceMapping/><virtualizationType>paravirtualized</virtualizationType><tagSet/></item></imagesSet></DescribeImagesResponse>
2013-10-04 14:49:51,021 DEBUG   DescribeImages -- end of response content --
{code}
This is a tools issue I opened https://eucalyptus TOOLS-390 and assigned it to myself

This is not a tools issue either it is not a bug.
[~gholms] You are correct Garrett the output from both ec2-describe-images and euca-describe-images are the same when pointed at the same image and endpoint. I am closing this as not a bug.
{code}
[mmunn:~]euca-register -n TEST_NAME tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5
[mmunn:~]ec2-describe-images emi-8F6837A5
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5	tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	096197277238	available	private		x86_64machine	eki-B02C3954	eri-F96C3F88	
[mmunn:~]euca-describe-images emi-8F6837A5
IMAGE	emi-8F6837A5	tmpq67moornav/precise-server-cloudimg-amd64-ext3.img.manifest.xml	096197277238	available	private	x86_64	machineeki-B02C3954	eri-F96C3F88		instance-store	paravirtualized
{code}

[~mmunn1]/[~gholms],

I am curious how this isn't a bug?  IIRC when you register an image in AWS, and you run ec2-describe-image, it displays the name of the mage that you registered it with.  Wouldn't this be an AWS behavior issue due to the fact we don't follow the same behavior?

An account number followed by an image name is the format for an EBS image. You are not comparing apples to apples.  Run the ec2-describe-image and euca-describe-images against both and instance-store and ebs image on Eualyptus.
After working with [~mmunn1], confirmed this issue is a tools issue - TOOLS-390 - which has been linked.
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
